newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH RAW WOOD PURCHASES UP IN JULY ON JUNE.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH RAW WOOD PURCHASES UP IN JULY ON JUNE.

text.p: The Finnish forest industry's raw wood purchases picked up slightly in July on June, but they were clearly lower than in July 1995, the Finnish Forest Research Institute METLA said in its monthly review on Friday.
Wood purchases from private forests were 0.7 million cubic metres in July, compared to 0.4 million cubic metres in June and 1.3 million cubic metres in July 1995, it said.
"Wood trade in private forests is currently too slow particularly compared to the demand of the sawmill industry, although it picked up slightly in July," METLA said.
